member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.Renderers.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Provides classes and interface for all cell renderer that manages the creation of cells view objects when the cell is scrolled into view and also unloading of the views. Contains logics to place the UIElement inside cells in display and edit mode. It also contains the custom views that are created for rendering in the grid.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridCellRendererBase
member.summary:
Represents a class that provides a default implementation of the interface for a cell renderer. You should derive from this class to implement custom cell renderer classes. There is however no dependency on GridCellRendererBase inside of the control.
If you want to implement a renderer with support for live views inside the cell you should derive from the or grid adapted GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase classes.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridCellRendererBase.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridCellRendererBase.SupportsRenderOptimization
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the renderer supports rendering itself directly to the drawing context. When this is possible the UIElement will only be created when the user moves the mouse over the cell or if the UIElement is needed for other reasons, e.g. animate after change. The benefit of rendering directly to the DrawingContext instead of creating the UIElement is a much improved scrolling performance.
member.value: True if the renderer supports optimization, otherwise false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridCellRendererBase.IsHeaderRenderer
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current renderer is header renderer

member.summary: Gets the current cell's row column index.
member.value: The current cell's row column index.

member.summary: Gets the view of the current cell.
member.value: The view of the current cell.

member.summary: Gets the view of the current cell element.
member.value: The view of the current cell element.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current cell is in editing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridCellRendererBase.IsFocused
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current cell is focused or not.
member.value: true if the current cell is focused; otherwise , false.
member.exception: Thrown when the cell is focused before the current cell state is maintained.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridCellRendererBase.OnUnloadViews(Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.DataColumnBase)
member.summary: Called from after a cell is scrolled out of view. VirtualizingCellRendererBase overrides this method and either removes the cell renderer visuals from the parent canvas or hide them and reuse it later in same canvas depending on whether GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase.AllowRecycle was set.
member.param: The dataColumn containing the details of the column.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridVirtualizingCellRenderer`2
member.summary:
GridVirtualizingCellRenderer is an abstract base class for cell renderer classes that need live views displayed in a cell. You can derive from this class and provide the type of the UIElement you want to show inside cells as type parameter. The class provides strong typed virtual methods for initializing Content of the cell and arranging the cell visuals. See for more details.
The idea behind this class is to provide a place where we can add general code that should be shared for all cell renderer classes in the tree derived from GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase. While this class does at the moment not add meaningful functionality to GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase we created this extra layer of inheritance to make it easy to share code for the GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase base class between grid and common assemblies and keep grid control specific code out of the base class. It is currently not possible with C# to the base class as template type parameter.
member.typeparam: The type of the UIElement that should be placed inside cells in display mode.
The type of the UIElement that should be placed inside cells in edit mode.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase`2
member.summary:
VirtualizingCellRendererBase is an abstract base class for cell renderer classes that need live views displayed in a cell. You can derive from this class and provide the type of the view you want to show inside cells as type parameter. The class provides strong typed virtual methods for initializing Content of the cell and arranging the cell visuals.
The class manages the creation of cells view objects when the cell is scrolled into view and also unloading of the views. The class offers an optimization in which Views can be recycled when is set. In this case when a cell is scrolled out of view it is moved into a recycle bin and the next time a new view is scrolled into view the element is recovered from the recycle bin and reinitialized with the new Content of the cell.
Updates to appearance and Content of child elements, creation and unloading of views will not trigger layout or render calls in parent canvas.
member.typeparam: The type of the UIElement that should be placed inside cells in display mode.
The type of the UIElement that should be placed inside cells in edit mode.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase`2.displayRecycleBin
member.summary: Recycles the display view elements for cells that were scrolled out of view.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase`2.editRecycleBin
member.summary: Recycles the edit view elements for cells that were scrolled out of view.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase`2.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase class.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase`2.AllowRecycle
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether views can be recycled when scrolled out of view. In this case when a cell is scrolled out of view it is moved into a recycle bin and the next time a new element is scrolled into view the element is recovered from the recycle bin and reinitialized with the new Content of the cell.
member.value: True if elements can be recycled when scrolled out of view, otherwise false. The default value is true.

VirtualizingCellRendererBase overrides this method and either removes the cell renderer visuals from the parent canvas or hide them and reuse it later in same canvas depending on whether GridVirtualizingCellRendererBase.AllowRecycle was set.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.VirtualizingCellUIElementBin`1
member.summary:
This class implements a cache of view of the given type parameter T. It is used by the renderer to recycle view elements for cells that were scrolled out of view and delay unloading of views.
This reduces the number of times the views needs to be created or unloaded and instead only the contents of the views will be reinitialized with cell contents.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.PullToRefreshView.IsIndeterminate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the indeterminate state of the pull to refresh view. The pull to refresh view will be in indeterminate state when the view is executing the .
member.value: True if the pull to refresh view is in indeterminate state, otherwise false. The default value is false.
member.remarks:
The pull to refresh view will be in indeterminate state, in the mean time pull to refresh command is executed, Refer the below code example in which the state is set as true before executing the and set as false, once the command is executed.
The indeterminate state of the pull to refresh view can also be tracked by the property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.PullToRefreshView.PullToRefreshCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets the command to be executed when performing the pulling operation to refresh the grid. This command will be fired upon performing the pulling operation for doing the refreshing operation.
member.value: The command to be executed when PullToRefresh action is performed.
member.remarks:
provides an option to refresh it when performing the pulling action. will be fired to refresh (add, delete or modify the underlying data) the grid. A busy indicator will be displayed to denote the refreshing operation.
The pull to refresh command can also be set using property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.PullToRefreshView.Progress
member.summary: Gets or sets the progress of pulling in the pull to refresh view can be tracked using this property. Once, the pulling progress is reached 100 %, fires, executing the command to be performed when the grid is pulled down for refreshing.
member.value: The progress of pulling in the pull to refresh view.
member.remarks: The user can manually refresh the grid in runtime by setting the to 100.

example.code: dataGrid.PullToRefreshView.Progress = 100;

member.summary: Executes the pull to refresh command.

member.summary: Represents a customized that loads new data items in runtime.
member.remarks:
A LoadMoreView represents a customized that is loaded either at the top or bottom based on the property.
LoadMore option can be enabled in a control, by setting the property to true and by setting the property. When the LoadMore is enabled, the provides an option to load a subset of data to its data source in the runtime using the .

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.SfDataGrid
member.summary: A data bound list control that displays the items from data source in a tabular view. The control allows you to select, sort and group these items.
member.remarks:
The control provides a flexible way to display a collection of data in rows and columns. The includes built-in column types and a template column for hosting custom Content.
To bind the to data, set the property to an implementation. Each row in the data grid is bound to an object in the data source, and each column in the data grid is bound to a property of the data object. In order for the user interface to update automatically when items are added to or removed from the source data, the must be bound to a collection that implements the interface, such as an . To automatically reflect property changes, the objects in the source collection must implement the interface.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.SfDataGrid.RowHeaderTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template that is used to display the contents of a row header. By default, nothing will be displayed in the row header. However, when this property is set, loads the template as the Content of the row header cells.
member.value: The template that displays the contents of a RowHeader.
member.remarks: To include the RowHeader column to , you need to set the to true. Initially when you set the SfDataGrid.ShowRowHeader = true, you will be able to see empty cells in front of the rows. enables the user to set the Content and the view to be loaded in the RowHeader by using property.

example.code:
<sfgrid:SfDataGrid ShowRowHeader="True">
<sfgrid:SfDataGrid.RowHeaderTemplate> <DataTemplate> <Label Text = "{Binding Index}" HorizontalTextAlignment = "Center" VerticalTextAlignment = "Center" /> </DataTemplate> </sfgrid:SfDataGrid.RowHeaderTemplate>
</sfgrid:SfDataGrid>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.SfDataGrid.PullToRefreshView
member.summary: Gets or sets the view to indicate the Progress of pulling operation in a . Any view that can indicate the Progress of the pulling can be assigned to the property such that it animates the values of the Progress of pulling.
member.value: The view that is displayed when pull to refresh is done.
member.remarks: provides you an option to refresh it when performing the pulling action. A command will be fired when pulling action is performed and it can be used to refresh (add, delete or modify the underlying data) in the grid. To enable the pull to refresh feature, you must set the to true and also must set the command to property. By default, a busy indicator will be displayed when doing the pulling action. However, allows you to customize this view based on the requirement using property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.SfDataGrid.AllowPullToRefresh
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable/disable the refreshing option upon pulling the grid. On enabling this property, provides an option to refresh it when performing the pulling action. The refreshing can be done using the and hence it is mandatory to set the property too for enabling the refreshing option.
member.value: True if pull to refresh is enabled, otherwise False. By default, value is false.
member.remarks: provides an option to refresh it when performing the pulling action. A command will be fired and it can be used to refresh (add, delete or modify the underlying data) the grid. To enable the pull to refresh feature, you must set the to true and also must set the property. By default, a busy indicator will be displayed when doing the pulling animation. However, allows you to customize this view based on the requirement using property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.SfDataGrid.PullToRefreshCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets the command to be executed when performing the pulling operation to refresh the grid. This command will be fired upon performing the pulling operation for doing the refreshing operation.
member.value: The command to be executed when PullToRefresh action is performed.
member.remarks: provides an option to refresh it when performing the pulling action. will be fired to refresh (add, delete or modify the underlying data) the grid. A busy indicator will be displayed to denote the pulling and refreshing operation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.SfDataGrid.ItemsSource
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the external data source of , to display the data in the grid. It supports the data sources such as , , and so on. property helps to bind the with the collection of objects.
member.value: The items source of the .
member.remarks: To bind the to data, set the property to an implementation. Each row in the data grid is bound to an object in the data source, and each column in the data grid is bound to a property of the data object. In order for the user interface to update automatically when items are added to or removed from the source data, the must be bound to a collection that implements the interface, such as an . To automatically reflect property changes, the objects in the source collection must implement the interface.

example.code: dataGrid.ItemsSource = viewModel.OrderInfoCollection;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.SfDataGrid.SortComparers
member.summary: Gets the of , for applying sorting to the columns based on the custom logic. allows you to sort columns based on custom logic when the standard sorting techniques do not meet the requirements. For each column, you can apply different sorting criteria by adding objects to collection.
member.value: The of .
member.remarks: allows you to sort columns based on custom logic when the standard sorting techniques do not meet the requirements. For each column, you can apply different sorting criteria by adding objects to collection. The has the two properties : which refers to of the column to apply sorting. and which refers to the custom sort comparer that implements the and interfaces.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.SfDataGrid.View
member.summary: Gets the current view of the . has the property of type interface that implements interface. View is responsible for maintaining and manipulating data and other advanced operations like Sorting, Grouping, and etc.
member.value: The collection view of the .
member.remarks: has the property of type interface that implements interface. When you bind collection to property, the will be created and maintains the operations on data such as grouping, sorting, insert, delete, and modification.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.SfDataGrid.CellRenderers
member.summary: Gets the that contains the cell renderers in . The manages the creation of cells view objects when the cell is scrolled into view and also unloading of the views. Contains logics to place the UIElement inside cells in display and edit mode.
member.value: The collection containing the renderers in the .
member.remarks:
The manages the creation of cells view objects when the cell is scrolled into view and also unloading of the views. Contains logics to place the UIElement inside cells in display and edit mode. The user can implement the renderer by extending it from the renderer he needs and customize the type of cell to be loaded for each column type in editing and normal mode.
Note:When the user overrides the renderer, he needs to replace it in the collection. For example, if the user implements the class, to customize the cell in the , then he needs to replace it in the collection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.SfDataGrid.Columns
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of the . The collection contains the columns in the which are created for each property in the model class. The user can add the various column types to the based on the requirement by specifying the which associates the property in the data source.
member.value: The columns collection of the .
member.remarks: The collection contains the columns in the which are created for each property in the model class. allows you to define the columns manually by adding the objects to the collection. There are different types of columns available in and you can create any column based on your requirement.

example.code: dataGrid.Columns.Add(new GridTextColumn() { MappingName = "OrderID" });

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.SfDataGrid.ColumnSizer
member.summary: Gets or sets the of the , that specify how columns in the are sized. applies width for all the in the collection based on the property.
member.value: The type of that is applied to the . The default value is .
member.remarks: The user can specify how columns in the are sized. applies width for all the in the collection based on the property. When the is , all the are adjusted an equal column width to fit within the view.

example.code: dataGrid.ColumnSizer = ColumnSizer.Star;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.SfDataGrid.SourceType
member.summary: Gets or sets the of the .
member.value: The type of the data source of .
member.remarks: The user can specify the type of in the property. The user may get the sometimes when binding with complex data collections which can easily be handled by simply specifying the type of in the as given in the code example.

example.code: dataGrid.SourceType = typeof(OrderInfo);

member.exception: Sometimes you may get this exception, if you get this exception, you need to set this property as given in the code example.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.SfDataGrid.AutoGenerateColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to generate the columns automatically or not. The creates columns automatically based on the property . It decides columns generation for based on the property.
member.value: True if auto generate columns is enabled, otherwise false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: The creates columns automatically based on the property . It decides columns generation for based on the property. The user can also customize the automatically generated column by using the event.

example.code: dataGrid.AutoGenerateColumns = true;

member.value: The height of the rows in the body and footer region of . The default value is 50.
member.remarks: allows you to customize the height of the grid rows in the body and footer region by setting the property. This property responds to runtime changes and hence you can customize it based on your requirement.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.SfDataGrid.SortColumnDescriptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of of . The user can get the columns that represent sorting from the collection. also allows the user to programmatically sort the column by adding the to the collection. The user must set the as true for enabling interactive sorting in a .
member.value: The collection of columns which represent sorting.
member.remarks: The user can get the columns that represent sorting from the collection. also allows the user to programmatically sort the column by adding the to the collection. The user must specify the column to be sorted in the which represents the of the column and the user can optionally set the direction of sorting to be applied by setting the . By default columns will be sorted in the ascending order.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.SfDataGrid.AllowSorting
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable/disable sorting in . When is set as true, the user can sort the data simply by tapping the column header he wishes to sort. also allows the user to programmatically sort the column by adding the to the collection.
member.value: True if sorting is enabled, otherwise false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: allows to sort the data by setting the as true. The user can sort the data by just tapping the column header he wishes to sort or programmatically sort the column by adding the to the collection. Once sorting is applied, the shows a sort icon in the respective column header indicating the direction of sorting.

example.code: dataGrid.AllowSorting = true;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.SfDataGrid.AllowTriStateSorting
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable tri-state sorting or not. By enabling the tri-state sorting in the , the data can be sorted in three states : ascending, descending and unsorted.
member.value: true if tri-state sorting is enabled, otherwise false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: also allows you to unsort the data in the original order by clicking the header again after sorting to descending order by setting the property to true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.SfDataGrid.AllowLoadMore
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable/disable the load more option for adding more records in runtime, when the grid is scrolled to the last record of the collection. On enabling this property, provides an option to add more items to the underlying collection when the is tapped, by executing the and hence it is mandatory to set the property too for enabling the load more option.
member.value: True, if load more is enabled, otherwise false. The default value is false.

provides an option to load more items in runtime, when the grid is scrolled to the last record of the collection. A command will be fired when the is tapped and it can be used to add more items to the underlying data. To enable the load more feature, you must set the to true and also must set the property. By default, a button will be displayed when the grid is scrolled to the last record. However, allows you to customize this view based on the requirement using property.
opacity animations cut for Android owing to the following issue .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.SfDataGrid.AutoGenerateColumnsForCustomType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to generate columns automatically for the custom types in data object. provides support for generate columns automatically for complex properties, when is set as true.
member.value: true if the custom type properties are automatically generated; otherwise , false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Setting AutoGenerateColumnsForCustomType to true and AutoGenerateColumnsModeForCustomType to Child, generate columns for inner properties.For example, OrderInfo class has Customer property of type Customer, then column generated like Customer.CustomerID.

example.code: dataGrid.AutoGenerateColumnsForCustomType = true;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.SfDataGrid.AutoGenerateColumnsModeForCustomType
member.summary: Gets or sets the that indicates whether to create the columns for custom parent type or child inner properties or custom type and its child properties.
member.value: The default is .
member.remarks: By default, the columns are created for custom parent type.

example.code: dataGrid.AutoGenerateColumnsModeForCustomType = AutoGenerateColumnsModeForCustomType.Both;

member.name: M:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.CoveredCellInfo.GetHashCode
member.summary:
GetHashCode is intended to serve as a hash function for this object. Based on the contents of the object, the hash function will return a suitable value with a relatively random distribution over the various inputs.
The default implementation returns the [....] block index for this instance. Calling it on the same object multiple times will return the same value, so it will technically meet the needs of a hash function, but it's less than ideal. Objects (especially value classes) should override this method.
member.returns: Return a suitable value with a relatively random distribution over the various inputs based on the contents of the object.

example.code: <syncfusion:GridTextColumn MappingName="Freight" Format="C"> <syncfusion:GridTextColumn.CellStyle> <Style TargetType = "syncfusion:GridCell" > <Setter Property="Foreground" Value="Red" /> </Style> </syncfusion:GridTextColumn.CellStyle> </syncfusion:GridTextColumn>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridColumn.Format
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that indicates the format applied for the Content of record cells in the column. enables the user to apply Format for the records in the cells by setting this property.
enables the user to populate the data for the using this property. This property enables the user to format the values of other columns and display the formatted value in unbound column.
member.value: The format applied to the record in the cells.
member.remarks:
enables the user to apply Format for the records in the cells by setting this property. Assign the FormatString to this property based on the type of the property the GridColumn is associated with to format the value.
enables the user to populate the data for the using this property. This property enables the user to format the values of other columns and display the formatted value in unbound column.

member.remarks: allows you to apply different for the GridColumns by using this property. Assign the FormatString to this property based on the type of the property the column is associated with to format the value. example.code: <syncfusion:GridTextColumn MappingName="OrderID"> <syncfusion:GridTextColumn.HeaderTemplate> <DataTemplate> <Label Text="OrderID" TextColor="Black" BackgroundColor="Yellow" YAlign="Center" /> </DataTemplate> </syncfusion:GridTextColumn.HeaderTemplate> </syncfusion:GridTextColumn>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridColumn.ValueBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the value binding that associates the column with a property in the data source. The value of the property in the underlying model object bound to the value binding will be the Content of the grid cell in edit mode.
member.value: The value binding that associates the column with a property in the data source.
member.remarks: The enables the user to display a different property as the Content of the grid cell, when the grid cell enters into edit mode. If the user wants to display a different property in edit mode, the user can make use of this property. While setting alone to the , the will be automatically generated based on the .

example.code: <syncfusion:SfDataGrid.Columns> <syncfusion:GridTextColumn MappingName = "CustomerID" DisplayBinding = "CustomerID" ValueBinding="{Binding OrderID}" /> </syncfusion:SfDataGrid.Columns>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridColumn.DisplayBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the display binding that associates the column with a property in the data source. The value of the property in the underlying model object bound to the Display binding will be the Content of the grid cell in normal mode. When the grid cell is entered into edit mode, The value of the property in the underlying model object bound to the will be the Content of the grid cell.
member.value: The display binding that associates the column with a property in the data source.
member.remarks: The display Content of is determined from property. It gets and sets the binding that associates the with a property in the data source. While setting alone to the , the will be automatically generated based on the .

example.code: <syncfusion:SfDataGrid.Columns> <syncfusion:GridTextColumn MappingName = "CustomerID" DisplayBinding="{Binding OrderID}" /> </syncfusion:SfDataGrid.Columns>

member.summary: Gets or sets a valueÂ that decidesÂ whether grouping is processed based on display value or edit value or value in the underlying collection of the column.
member.value: The that decidesÂ whether grouping is processed based on display value or edit value or value in the underlying collection of the column. The default value is .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridColumn.CellType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the cell type of the . This property is used to identify the type of the column. This property must be specified with a string value when creating a custom column extending from the base class.
member.value: The CellType of the .
member.remarks: enables the user to create their own column type when the available column type does not meet his requirements. The user must set the of the grid column to the type of UIElement to be loaded in the grid cell. It is mandatory to create a custom cell renderer for the custom column created and it must be added in the collection. The user can handle his customizations in the custom renderer class implementing the .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridColumn.SortMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a valueÂ that decidesÂ whether sorting calculation is processed based on display value in case of indexer and complex properties or default value in case of CLR properties
member.value: The that decidesÂ whether sorting calculation is processed based on display value or default value. The default value is .
member.remarks: By default, the sorting for the column will be calculated using DataReflectionMode Default only. For complex properties use DataReflectionMode.Display to fetch values using custom logic. For simple CLR properties use DataReflectionMode.Default to fetch values using default logic.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridTextColumn
member.summary: Represents a column that hosts textual Content in its cells.

remarks.para: Use GridTextColumn to display columns of data as text. To create a column, add it to the collection and to populate the data to the column set the to the property in the data source. dataGrid.Columns.Add(new GridTextColumn() { MappingName = "OrderID" });

The data can also be populated to the column by using the property. The Binding property is applied to the view created in the column. The for the view in each cell is the data item for the row the cell is present. Therefore, to set up the binding you only have to set the . Optionally, you can specify a if you want to convert the data.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridTemplateColumn
member.summary: Represents a column that hosts template-specified Content in its cells.
member.remarks:
Use GridTemplateColumn to display the value in the template of your requirement.
The GridTemplateColumn type enables you to create your own column types by specifying the cell template or cell template selector to use for displaying value. To specify the template that is used to display the contents of a cell, set the property. and to set the template selector, use property.

example.code: <syncfusion:GridTemplateColumn.CellTemplate> <DataTemplate> <Label Text = "{Binding CustomerID}" TextColor="Black" XAlign="Center" YAlign="Center" /> </DataTemplate> </syncfusion:GridTemplateColumn.CellTemplate>

member.name: M:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridTemplateColumn.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the GridTemplateColumn class.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridTemplateColumn.CellTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template that is used to display the contents of a cell.
member.value: The that is used to display the contents of a cell.
member.remarks: allows the user to customize the GridColumn with your own view by setting the of . To specify the template that is used to display the contents of a cell, set the property.

example.code: <syncfusion:GridTemplateColumn MappingName="CustomerID"> <syncfusion:GridTemplateColumn.CellTemplate> <DataTemplate> <Label Text = "{Binding CustomerID}" TextColor="Black" XAlign="Center" YAlign="Center" /> </DataTemplate> </syncfusion:GridTemplateColumn.CellTemplate> </syncfusion:GridTemplateColumn>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridTemplateColumn.CellTemplateSelector
member.summary: Gets or sets the template selector that selects the template in which the Content of the cell to be displayed.
member.value: The that selects the template in which the Content of the cell to be displayed.
member.remarks: allows the user to customize the GridColumn with your own view by setting the of . When the user wants to select the template between the available templates based on the value in the underlying collection, the user can use this property. The Content of the cell will be displayed in the template selected.

example.code: <sfgrid:GridTemplateColumn MappingName="Freight" > <sfgrid:GridTemplateColumn.CellTemplateSelector> <local:FreightTemplateSelector High = "{StaticResource high}" Average="{StaticResource average}" Low="{StaticResource low}"/> </sfgrid:GridTemplateColumn.CellTemplateSelector> </sfgrid:GridTemplateColumn>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridTemplateColumn.EditTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the to load in editing mode.
member.value: The template that is used to display the contents of cell in a column that is in editing mode. The default is null.
member.remarks: To specify the template that is used to display the contents of a cell when entering edit mode, set the property.

example.code: <syncfusion:GridTemplateColumn MappingName="CustomerID"> <syncfusion:GridTemplateColumn.EditTemplate> <DataTemplate> <Entry Text = "{Binding CustomerID}" /> </ DataTemplate > </ syncfusion:GridTemplateColumn.EditTemplate> </syncfusion:GridTemplateColumn>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridTemplateColumn.EditTemplateSelector
member.summary: Gets or sets the by choosing a template based on bound data objects and data-bound element in editing mode.
member.value: A custom object that provides logic and returns a that is in edit mode of column. The default is null.
member.remarks: can customize the GridColumn with any view by setting the of

example.code: <sfgrid:GridTemplateColumn MappingName="Freight" > <sfgrid:GridTemplateColumn.EditTemplateSelector> <local:FreightTemplateSelector High = "{StaticResource high}" Average="{StaticResource average}" Low="{StaticResource low}"/> </sfgrid:GridTemplateColumn.EditTemplateSelector> </sfgrid:GridTemplateColumn>

member.name: M:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridTemplateColumn.CanEditCell
member.summary: Determines whether the column is editable.
member.returns: Returns true if all the cells with in the column is editable .

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridPickerColumn
member.summary: Represents a column that hosts in its cells.
member.remarks:
Use GridPickerColumn to display columns of picker data as a .
To create a column, add it to the collection. To populate the column, bind the column to the data by using the property. The Binding property is applied to the view created in the column. The for the view in each cell is the data item for the row the cell is in. Therefore, to set up the binding you only have to set the . Optionally, you can specify a if your data source and target are different types.

example.code: <sfGrid:SfDataGrid.Columns> <sfgrid:GridPickerColumn BindingContext = "{x:Reference viewModel}" HeaderText="Dealer Name" ItemsSource="{Binding CustomerNames}" MappingName="DealerName"/> </sfGrid:SfDataGrid.Columns>

member.summary: Gets or sets the display member path that associates the column with a property in the data source. The property of the collection bound to the display member path will be the Content of the grid cell in normal and editing mode. The value will be displayed in the grid cell only when the is equal to the , else the grid cell will be blank. But the value corresponding to the given property in the data source will be displayed in the picker in edit mode.
member.value: The display member path that associates the column with a property in the data source.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value member path of the that associates the column with a property in the data source. The column in the collection whose is equal to the value member path, will be updated with the corresponding value for the selected item in the picker, when editing in the is ended.
member.value: The value member path that associates the column with a property in the data source.

Use GridComboBoxColumn to display the columns of SfCombobox data as a .
To create a column, add it to the collection. To populate the column, bind the column to the data by using the property. The Binding property is applied to the view created in the column. member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridComboBoxColumn.DisplayMemberPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the display member path that associates the column with a property in the data source. The property of the collection bound to the display member path will be the Content of the grid cell in normal and editing mode. The value will be displayed in the grid cell only when the is equal to the , else the grid cell will be blank. But the value corresponding to the given property in the data source will be displayed in the picker in edit mode.
member.value: The display member path that associates the column with a property in the data source.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value member path of the that associates the column with a property in the data source. member.value: The value member path that associates the column with a property in the data source.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridDateTimeColumn
member.summary: Represents a column that hosts in its cells.
member.remarks:
Use to display columns of date-time as picker data in .
To create a column, add it to the collection. To populate the column, bind the column to the data by using the property. The Binding property is applied to the view created in the column. The for the view in each cell is the data item for the row the cell is in. Therefore, to set up the binding you only have to set the . Optionally, you can specify a if your data source and target are different types.

example.code: <sfGrid:SfDataGrid.Columns> <sfgrid:GridDateTimeColumn Format="d" HeaderText="Shipped Date" MappingName="ShippedDate" /> </sfGrid:SfDataGrid.Columns>

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridNumericColumn
member.summary: Represents a column that hosts numeric Content in its cells.
member.remarks:
Use GridNumericColumn to display columns of data in numeric format.
To create a column, add it to the collection. To populate the column, bind the column to the data by using the property. The Binding property is applied to the view created in the column. The for the view in each cell is the data item for the row the cell is in. Therefore, to set up the binding you only have to set the . Optionally, you can specify a if you want to convert the data.

example.code: <sfGrid:SfDataGrid.Columns> <sfgrid:GridNumericColumn NumberDecimalDigits="0" HeaderText="Product No" MappingName="ProductNo"/> </sfGrid:SfDataGrid.Columns>

member.summary: Gets or sets the template that is used to display the contents of a summary column.
member.value: The that is used to display the contents of a caption summary cell.
member.remarks: allows the user to customize the GridSummaryColumn with your own view by setting the of . To specify the template that is used to display the contents of a caption summary cell, set the property. also allows the user to customize the GridSummaryColumn with different type of views by setting to the .

example.code: <syncfusion:GridSummaryColumn.Template> <DataTemplate> <Label Text = "Caption Column" TextColor="Black" XAlign="Center" YAlign="Center" /> </DataTemplate> </syncfusion:GridSummaryColumn.Template>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridSummaryColumn.CustomAggregate
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom aggregate of the GridSummary column. provides the built in aggregate types for calculating the values for the GridSummary column in the of the GridSummaryColumn. The user can implement their own aggregate function when the built in aggregate function does not meet his requirement using this property. When the user defines his own aggregate function in the , he needs to set the as .
member.value: The custom aggregate of the GridSummary column.
member.remarks: allows you to implement your own aggregate functions, when the built-in aggregate functions do not meet your requirement.The user can calculate the summary values based on custom logic using this property. When the user defines his own aggregate function in the , he needs to set the as .

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the summary column that helps to denote the GridSummaryColumn in . The user can format the summary value for row using when set to true.
member.value: The name of the summary column.
member.remarks: The caption of the summary can be displayed either in the summary row or summary column, if the caption is displayed in the summary row by setting as true. The summary row defines the which makes use of the to display its value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridSummaryColumn.SummaryType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the summary type of the GridSummary column for calculating values of the GridSummary column. provides the built in aggregate types for calculating the values for the GridSummary column in the . The user can implement their own aggregate function when the built in aggregate function does not meet his requirement using property.
member.value: The of the summary column.
member.remarks: provides the built in aggregate types for calculating the values for the GridSummary column in the . The user can implement their own aggregate function when the built in aggregate function does not meet his requirement using property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridSummaryColumn.SummaryMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a valueÂ that decidesÂ whether summary calculation is processed based on display value in case of indexer and complex properties or default value in case of CLR properties of the column.
member.value: The that decidesÂ whether summary calculation is processed based on display value or default value. The default value is .
member.remarks: By default, the summary for the column will be calculated using DataReflectionMode Default only. For complex properties use DataReflectionMode.Display to fetch values using custom logic. For simple CLR properties use DataReflectionMode.Default to fetch values using default logic. DataReflectionMode.Value is not applicable for the summary column.

member.summary: Gets or sets the column name for grouping. This property represents the of the column which should be grouped.
member.value: The column name for grouping.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GroupColumnDescription.Converter
member.summary: Gets or sets the converter for grouping. This property is used when the user needs to group the column with their custom logic. The user must assign the converter class implementing the to this property.
member.value: The converter for grouping.
member.remarks: allows you to group a column based on custom logic when the standard grouping techniques do not meet the requirements. When the user wants to apply grouping to the column based on his custom logic, he needs to the write the converter class implementing the and assign it to this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GroupColumnDescription.Comparer
member.summary: Gets or sets the comparer for the apply grouping based on custom logic.
member.value: The comparer for apply grouping based on custom logic. The default value is null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GroupColumnDescription.SortGroupRecords
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether to sort the inner records of the group while using custom grouping.
member.value: The default value is false.
member.remarks: By default, grouped column's records are not sorted since the values of all the records in a group will be the same. So, groups will only be sorted based on group key. In custom grouping cases, grouped column's record values may differ. So in this case, you can sort the records of a group by setting the SortGroupRecords property to true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.StackedColumn.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the display text of the .
member.value: The display text of the stacked column header. The default value of header text is the of the stacked column.

example.code: StackedColumn column = new StackedColumn (); column.Text = "Order ID";

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.StackedColumn.TextSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the font size for the Content of header cell in the . The default value is 14. The font size for the content of header cell in the can be customized by using the this property.
member.value: The font size for the Content of header cell in the . The default value is 14.
member.remarks: The font size for the Content of header cell in the StackedColumn can be customized by using the this property. However this property will not work if is used for a .

example.code: StackedColumn column = new StackedColumn (); column.TextSize= 16;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.StackedColumn.Font
member.summary: Gets or sets the font family for the Content of header cell in the . The font family for the Content of header cells in the can be customized by using this property.
member.value: The FontFamily for the Content of header cell in the column. The default value is "HelveticaNeue LT 55 Roman".

example.code: StackedColumn column = new StackedColumn (); column.Font = â€œHelvetica Neueâ€;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.StackedColumn.FontAttribute
member.summary: Gets or sets the that describes the font style for the Content of the header cell in the enables the user to apply different font attributes to the Content of the header cells using this property. The header text can be customized as bold or Italic using this property.
member.value: Represents the that describes the font style for the Content of the header cell in the . The default value is .

example.code: StackedColumn column = new StackedColumn (); column.FontAttribute= FontAttributes.Bold;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.StackedColumn.TextAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the for the header cell in the stacked column. The default alignment for the header cells in is center and you can customize this to Start or End.
member.value: The for the header cell in the column. The default value is .

example.code: StackedColumn column = new StackedColumn (); column.TextAlignment = TextAlignment.Start;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.StackedColumn.Template
member.summary: Gets or sets the template used to display the header of the current . allows you to customize the header cell based on your requirement by using this property.
member.value: The template used to display the header of the current Stacked column.

example.code: <syncfusion:SfDataGrid.StackedHeaderRows> <syncfusion:StackedHeaderRow > <syncfusion:StackedHeaderRow.StackedColumns> <syncfusion:StackedColumn ChildColumns="OrderID,CustomerID, CustomerName, ShipCity,Country" Text="Sales Details" MappingName="SalesDetails"> <syncfusion:StackedColumn.Template> <DataTemplate> <Label Text="OrderID" TextColor="Black" BackgroundColor="Yellow" YAlign="Center" /> </DataTemplate> </syncfusion:StackedColumn.Template> </syncfusion:StackedColumn> </syncfusion:StackedHeaderRow.StackedColumns> </syncfusion:StackedHeaderRow > </syncfusion:SfDataGrid.StackedHeaderRows>

ExtScrollViewer is a customized that scrolls its Content in both horizontal and vertical direction if the Content exceeds the view area.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.GridRowInfo.GetHashCode
member.summary:
GetHashCode is intended to serve as a hash function for this object. Based on the contents of the object, the hash function will return a suitable value with a relatively random distribution over the various inputs.
The default implementation returns the [....] block index for this instance. Calling it on the same object multiple times will return the same value, so it will technically meet the needs of a hash function, but it's less than ideal. Objects (especially value classes) should override this method.
member.returns: Return a suitable value with a relatively random distribution over the various inputs based on the contents of the object.

member.returns: Returns a boolean indicating if the passed object is Equal to this.

member.name: E:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.DataPager.SfDataPager.OnDemandLoading
member.summary: Occurs when loading the page on demand. This event fires only when is enabled.
member.remarks: In normal Paging, data collection is entirely loaded initially to the . However, also allows the user to load the data for the current page dynamically by setting the setting this property to true. To load current page item dynamically you must hook the event. In the event, use the method to load the data for the corresponding page in .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfDataGrid.XForms.DataPager.SfDataPager.EnableGridPaging
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to create source from or .
member.value: True, if the source is created from , otherwise false. The default value is true.
member.remarks:
The items can be loaded in the by two ways: normal paging and on demand paging. In normal paging, all the items are loaded initially when the grid is loaded. In on demand paging, the items are loaded to the grid only when navigating to the page i.e. items are loaded dynamically on demand.
When Normal paging is used, the source is created from , since it has to load all the items to the grid. When on demand paging is used, the source is created from , since it has to load the items to the grid for the current page only.
When is set as true, it is necessary to hook the event to load the items dynamically to the grid and set to true.

member.summary: Gets or sets the items source of the . is bind to the observable collection of data. This property is set only when normal paging is used, since setting this property loads all the items to the grid initially.
member.value: The items source of the .
member.remarks:
The items source of the is set to the collection, based on which is created internally. The is set as .
The items can be loaded in the by two ways: normal paging and on demand paging. In normal paging, all the items are loaded initially when the grid is loaded. In on demand paging, the items are loaded to the grid only when navigating to the page i.e. items are loaded dynamically on demand. property should not be assigned when on demand paging is used.

example.code: sfPager.Source = viewModel.Info; sfGrid.ItemsSource = sfPager.PagedSource;

When on demand paging is enabled, the generation of items is handled by the event, hence it is necessary to hook the . The user cannot assign a value to the when using on demand paging, since the items for the current page is generated only when navigated to that page.

member.remarks: In normal Paging, data collection is entirely loaded initially to the .
